index_only-in-languages: *For now only in bulgarian (modules and resources), together with the original resources in english
index_stop-wasting-time: Stop wasting time searching for problems and tutorials. Olympiads XYZ provides a
index_carefully-designed-crafted: carefully designed and crafted for olympiad contestants – available to everyone, for free
index_a_what-is-olympiads-xyz: Olympiads XYZ is a comprehensive, organized resource designed to help students prepare for science olympiads, with a current focus on physics. We provide curated modules, practice problems, and progress-tracking tools to support independent learning.
index_a_who-is-this-website-for: It is mainly for Bulgarian students (but technically for everyone!) at various school levels who are interested in science competitions, especially physics olympiads. The resources are organized by grade and topic complexity, making it suitable for both beginners and advanced students.
index_q_multiple-languages: Are the resources available in multiple languages?
index_a_multiple-languages: Unfortunately, as of now the modules are only in Bulgarian, as the creators of the website are Bulgarian and the target audience is Bulgarian students. Most of the resources are originally in English, but the modules here are only in Bulgarian (for now!)
index_a_topics: Currently, our modules focus on physics topics needed for physics olympiads, ranging from foundational concepts to advanced topics. In the future, we may expand to cover additional science subjects, with contributions from volunteers.
index_q_how-do-i-use-modules: How do I start using the modules?
index_a_how-do-i-use-modules: Begin by selecting your school grade level, then choose a specific topic within physics that you want to study. Each module includes explanations, key concepts, and practice problems to reinforce understanding.
index_q_how-can-i-track-my-progress: How can I track my progress?
index_a_how-can-i-track-my-progress: After creating an account, you can mark sections you’ve covered, modules you’ve completed, and problems you’ve solved. This helps you keep track of what you've accomplished and what’s left to study.
index_q_official-syllabus: Are these modules aligned with official olympiad syllabi?
index_a_official-syllabus: No, the modules are specially curated from various resources to make complex topics easier to understand and master. They’re not based on any official syllabus but are designed to help with typical olympiad topics.
index_q_contribute: Can I contribute to Olympiads XYZ?
index_a_contribute: Yes! If you have expertise in science topics for any olympiad and would like to contribute, please reach out through our contact form. We welcome collaboration, especially for subjects beyond physics.
index_a_free: Yes. Olympiads XYZ is free to use, as we aim to make olympiad preparation accessible to all students. But any donations will be more than welcomed and will help to keep the website up and running.
index_a_is-there-a-catch: There is none. The website is created by former olympiad contenders who know the struggle when it comes to self preparation.
index_a_practice-problem-selection: Practice problems are chosen to highlight core ideas and concepts within each topic. They are curated to be challenging but manageable, reinforcing key skills needed for olympiads.
index_q_stuck-on-problem: What if I get stuck on a problem?
index_a_stuck-on-problem: Try reviewing the related concepts in the module, and break down the problem into smaller steps. If you’re still stuck, consider discussing it with peers or using online resources. We hope to add a forum for discussion in the future!
index_copyright: No part of this website may be reproduced or commercialized in any manner without prior written permission.

top-nav_geography_description: Problems and resources for the geography olympiad preparation

author: Author
module_progress_tooltip: You can use this as a way to track your progress throughout the website.
not_signed_in_tooltip: Sign in to save your progress and sync your settings across devices.
sign_in_tooltip: Signing in allows you to sync your data with our servers (highly recommended). If this is your first time signing in, you will have the option to upload your local data to the server.
sign_in_with_email_already_exists: An account with this email already exists, please sign in with Google to link the two accounts.
contact_us_subtitle: Contact us about anything: suggestions, bugs, assistance, and more!
contact_us_subtitle_extra: This will be submitted as a public
message_received_info: Your message has been submitted as an issue in our GitHub repository. You can track the issue here:
email_invalid: Please enter a valid email address.
contact_us_warning: Keep in mind that Olympiads XYZ is not affiliated with any national or international olympiads.
submit_pull_request_info: is the preferred way to fix a mistake. See
mistake_examples: typo, broken link, wrong units, missing minus
unclear_explanation_info: Try first to understand the given text, and only if you cannot, then report it as a mistake. Don't just assume everything is unclear.
website_bug_info: Explain the bug as well as possible, including the page and what you were doing.
message_must_be_at_least_10_chars: Message must be at least 10 chars.
focus-problem: Focus Problem – try your best to solve this problem before continuing!
incomplete-section-text: Any help would be appreciated! Just submit a Pull Request on

no-solution: We haven't written a solution for this problem yet. If needed, request one using the "Contact Us" button!
solution-sketch-tooltip: This solution is still a work-in-progress. It may be vague or incomplete.
starred-tooltip: We highly recommend you do all starred problems!
has-not-appeared-hint: Historically, this module has not appeared in this division before. However, it can still show up in future contests.
rare-hint: Historically, this module infrequently appears in this division.
not-frequent-hint: Historically, this module has only appeared in this division once or twice.
somewhat-frequent-hint: Historically, this module has appeared somewhat frequently for this division.
very-frequent-hint: Historically, this module has been known to appear at least once per contest. However, this does not guarantee that it will show up again in future contests.
module_something-missing: Something is missing in this module.
no-problems-found-description: No problems were found matching your search criteria. Try changing your search or filters.

confirm-close-all-files: Are you sure you want to close all files? You'll lose all your changes.

submit-user-sol_solution-code-instructio: Since solutions are currently uploaded directly to the page, please keep the following in mind:
Solutions are in markdown (MDX) format and must be compilable, otherwise an error will occur
Follow the template in the module

Ensure your solutions are concise and error-free. If additional explanations or calculations are required, you can directly submit a request for an embedded solution through the <5>Editor on the website
help-others-out-by-submitting-a-solution: Help others out by submitting a solution for
submit-user-sol_share-solution-descripti: This will allow other users to view your solution if they are stuck.
submit-user-sol_solution-submitted-descr: Thanks for helping us improve Olympiads XYZ!
submit-user-sol_solution-too-long: Your solution seems too long! Max. 2500 characters.
nonexistent-problem-id: This problem ID does not exist, if this is a problem that will be added soon, ignore this message.

module-id-format-invalid: Module ID format is invalid, should contain only lowercase letters, numbers and dashes.
problem-id-format-invalid: Problem ID format is invalid, should contain only lowercase letters, numbers and dashes.
